pr_title: [JEP-227] Replace Acegi Security with Spring Security & upgrade Spring Framework

timeline.message: NPE from User.get
Need to implement setDetails in former subtypes of AbstractAuthenticationToken
Custom subtypes of UserDetails must be round-tripped
Need to translate UserDetails values for Authentication.principal
Align User.serialVersionUID with the Acegi Security version
Deprecated stub for WebAuthenticationDetails
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
Added AuthenticationProvider & AbstractUserDetailsAuthenticationProvider
Adding FieldUtils, used by tests in a few plugins
Binary compatibility for PrincipalSid and GrantedAuthoritySid constructors
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
Restoring some methods in AuthenticationException, called from AbstractAuthenticationManager in LDAPAuthenticationManager
Restoring serial form compatibility for GrantedAuthorityImpl
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
Restored SecurityContextImpl
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
To avoid Java serialization issues, HudsonPrivateSecurityRealm.Details no longer implements UserDetails
Update detached ldap to compatible version from https://github.com/jenkinsci/ldap-plugin/pull/48
AccessDeniedException2Test → AccessDeniedException3Test
Ensure ExceptionTranslationFilter still works if a plugin throws AccessDeniedException2
Binary compatibility for BasicHeaderAuthenticator
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
Restored AuthenticationServiceException
Binary compatibility for HudsonPrivateSecurityRealm.Details.getAuthorities
Restored User.setAuthorities
To be useful from ActiveDirectoryUserDetail, overridable setAuthorities needs to be called from the ctor (yes this is an antipattern)
INFRA-266 Adjust test for plugins over https
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
Merge branch 'UpdateCenter2Test.install' into spring-5303
Merge branch 'fix-test' of github.com:timja/jenkins into spring-5303

Round-tripping SecurityRealm.AUTHENTICATED_AUTHORITY as object identity: https://github.com/jenkinsci/saml-plugin/blob/351a0210a31c2368b5630c91316afe8bee3b0f5f/src/main/java/org/jenkinsci/plugins/saml/SamlUserDetailsService.java#L62
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303

Catching and translating AuthenticationException & AcegiSecurityException more broadly.
Should improve compatibility for code like: https://github.com/jenkinsci/matrix-auth-plugin/blob/9616b3877395aa1e8b0b403601a968fa7a461193/src/main/java/org/jenkinsci/plugins/matrixauth/AuthorizationContainerDescriptor.java#L139-L167
https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-security/releases/tag/5.3.4.RELEASE
Use JUnit 5
While UsernameNotFoundException extends BadCredentialsException in Acegi Security, in Spring Security it directly extends AuthenticationException
Documenting that Run.fromExternalizableId can throw AccessDeniedException
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303

timeline.bodyText: does this even need to be exposed (could be said that it is just a poilluting methid in the previous version) and the only legitimate use case is in close
timeline.author: jtnord

replies.bodyText: use case in https://github.com/jenkinsci/jenkins/pull/4848/files#diff-7703322191e82930e0d5d450dc9ba1adR322
replies.author: jtnord

replies.bodyText: Probably true, AFAIK it is unused.
replies.author: jglick
jglick

replies.bodyText: just that one occurrence in Jenkins.  basically backtracking authentication after elevation when an operation failed (was checking if an item existed, which needs to run as the system user).
replies.author: jtnord

replies.bodyText: Right. Anyway, I can mark this restricted, or just leave it as is—harmless, reasonably intuitive getter.
replies.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText:
would it be possible to @Restrict(NoExternalUse.class) this (so that forces plugins to upgrade).
perhaps that is a general question that should be asked higher up?

replies.bodyText: That is a general question and my answer is emphatically no. @Deprecated means it will continue to work but you should switch to the new thing as soon as you can. That is exactly the case. Abuse of @Restricted has caused terrible headaches.
replies.author: jglick

timeline.message:
AbstractAuthenticationToken should be @Deprecated

Co-authored-by: James Nord <jtnord@users.noreply.github.com>
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
Apparently the ~2h of functional tests do not include the corner case that you mistyped your password
Reverting unintentional Javadoc change
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
Round-trip org.acegisecurity.Authentication, making LdapMultiEmbedded2Test.login pass in PCT
Round-trip DataAccessException, for PCT in LdapMultiEmbeddedTest
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
Bumping detached copy of ldap, for now to the release of https://github.com/jenkinsci/ldap-plugin/pull/48
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
org.acegisecurity.ui.remember → org.acegisecurity.ui.rememberme
TokenBasedRememberMeServices2 is not intended as an API
UserDetailsSpringImpl can be marked deprecated to avoid warnings about references
Round-trip RememberMeServices subtypes, expected by crowd2
TokenBasedRememberMeServices placeholder for CrowdServletFilter
crowd2 uses AccountExpiredException, CredentialsExpiredException, & InsufficientAuthenticationException
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-security/releases/tag/5.4.0
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
Handle calls to super.getPostLogOutUrl without StackOverflowError
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
Compatibility for ProviderNotFoundException
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
Binary compatibility for ImpersonatingUserDetailsService, used by at least https://github.com/apefactory/cloudfoundry-uaa-oauth
Restoring SecurityRealm.createCliAuthenticator to minimize disruption

Restricted a lot of APIs which should not be used in plugins.
Gathered this list by looking at incompatible changes in japicmp.
Most are in fact unused; collabnet plugin uses many, but seems to be a blind copy-paste from core.
ExceptionTranslationFilter now merely extended the Spring version, so may as well delete.
Suppress some doclint as in https://github.com/jenkinsci/plugin-pom/pull/356
Broken Javadoc reference after da3d17b85f80c47cd227ba4ab169508e19271c41
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-security/releases/tag/5.4.1
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303

DisabledException & LockedException referenced from https://github.com/jenkinsci/cas-plugin/blob/d17aa8583af17dfdb8e069c41f986f2d844a719c/src/main/java/org/jenkinsci/plugins/cas/spring/security/AcegiAuthenticationManager.java#L53-L56

HttpSessionContextIntegrationFilter2 is used by cas and collabnet plugins.
Unrestricting it will not allow versions built on Acegi Security to work, since its signature is changing,
but will at least allow newer versions rewritten to Spring Security to retain this functionality.
Ideally there would be some more opaque mechanism to make more pieces of SecurityRealm.createFilter reusable
(this one is not in commonFilters shared with LegacySecurityRealm).

timeline.bodyText: jenkinsci/lib-access-modifier#28 would be useful here and in a few other places.
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText: Not sure what to do with this. Could deprecate fireFailedToLogIn, though some security realms might be able to support it. Could introduce an overload with no name, though that seems pretty useless. Not sure if anyone even listens to this event to begin with.
timeline.author: jglick

replies.bodyText: I'd kind of like to get more data exposed in audit-log-plugin, though that doesn't appear to listen for this event yet. It is listening for login and logout events, though, so it would make sense to support.
replies.author: jvz

replies.bodyText:
Right. I spent a bit of time trying to figure out how to restore this, without success. If you find something, I guess it can be added later.
In terms of impact, I can find only https://github.com/jenkinsci/datadog-plugin/blob/6d327f9e6719ee01689e10410b627b39958c7fad/src/main/java/org/datadog/jenkins/plugins/datadog/listeners/DatadogSecurityListener.java#L131-L134 and 
  
    
      jenkins/core/src/main/java/hudson/security/AbstractPasswordBasedSecurityRealm.java
    
    
         Line 101
      in
      f04114c
    
    
    
    

        
          
           SecurityListener.fireFailedToAuthenticate(username); 
        
    
  

 still fires that event.
replies.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText: Was helpful during development, and seems harmless to leave in.
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText: Was helpful during development, and seems harmless to leave in.
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText: Whatever it was all this did, it does not appear to have had any test coverage, and may well be obsolete given Spring Security implementation details.
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText: See deprecation Javadoc for InvalidatableUserDetails.
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText: Was used with BeanBuilder.
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText: If this did something, I am not sure what, and it is not covered by tests.
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText: Spring Security changed a number of things that in Acegi Security were setters into constructor arguments plus final fields.
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText: No particular reason to switch to the Spring Security version of this package, which would require pulling in the spring-security-acl module as well as disruption to existing AuthorizationStrategys: so long as you stick to the String-based constructors, there is no conflict with usage of other Spring Security types.
timeline.author: jglick

replies.bodyText: Should spring-security-acl be blocked as a dependency then?
replies.author: jvz

replies.bodyText: What do you mean? It is not included as a dependency by this PR.
replies.author: jglick

replies.bodyText: I meant as a precautionary measure so that downstream plugins don't think they should switch to that library just because of the rest of the Spring Security upgrade. I don't know if there's anything worth preventing, though, beyond confusion.
replies.author: jvz

timeline.bodyText: Only striving to retain compatibility for plugins referring to this constant, not the rest of the class.
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText: Weak typing here.
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText: Just retained the methods I actually saw being used in test code.
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText: Was using the super-old password hashes.
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.message: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
Merge branch 'master' into spring-5303

timeline.bodyText: I think so. BouncyCastle provides BCrypt, too, so it's not like a separate library was needed in the first place.
timeline.author: jvz

replies.bodyText: We cannot use BouncyCastle from core, though.
replies.author: jglick

replies.bodyText: I suppose it shouldn't matter for this case, then, since Spring Security already includes a BCrypt implementation in its own dependencies like you mentioned in the comment here. Does this limitation include for remoting? That'd be annoying if the only way to support TLS 1.3 connections there is to use Java 11 or customizing your classpath manually.
replies.author: jvz

replies.bodyText: Not sure what you are talking about. BouncyCastle is bundled only in a wrapper plugin for use by other plugins.
replies.author: jglick

replies.bodyText: BouncyCastle has JSSE glue to support TLS 1.3 in older JDKs than 11. Classes like SSLContext call into that which is the usual class for handling TLS code in Java.
replies.author: jvz

replies.bodyText: Sorry, do not know anything about it. Off topic I suppose. The point here is that for now I kept the existing behavior of using our own bundled jBCrypt, but now that Spring Security also bundles their own copy, we could consider switching to that and dropping our dep. I did not attempt to do so here because the format uses by BCryptPasswordEncoder does not match that of existing saved passwords in Jenkins, so we would need to do more work.
replies.author: jglick

timeline.author: jglick

+    public static void setProtectedFieldValue(String protectedField, Object object, Object newValue) {

timeline.bodyText: noting regression https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-64746 addressed in #5216
timeline.author: jtnord

timeline.message: Replacing Acegi Security with Spring Security
more
Change of approach: completely deprecating org.acegisecurity types
More conversion
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
More
Progress
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
Seems that everything except uses of BeanBuilder now compiles
Rewrite BeanBuilder configuration of security to plain old Java
core module now at least compiles
Starting to make tests compilable; will require changes to jenkins-test-harness
Tweaking AuthenticationProcessingFilter2

timeline.bodyText: There is no replacement for AcegiSecurityException. AFAIK the purpose of this class is to nicely handle 403s, so this should be good enough.
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText: Just a signature change in Spring.
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText: Just translating the Groovy into equivalent Java.
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText: Deriving from the Acegi Security version in hopes of offering some compatibility, but untested.
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText: InvalidatableUserDetails was deprecated, so deleting this filter and hoping it was in fact unnecessary.
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText: Did not see an easy way to translate this to Spring Security. There is a StandardPasswordEncoder and a MessageDigestPasswordEncoder but these are deprecated and considered insecure. Since this password format was last stored eight years ago, it does not seem worth saving.
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText: Seems to be obsolete: https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-security/blob/56928f61f0f0dbba8dc5c7c6a99746abc39f8230/web/src/main/java/org/springframework/security/web/authentication/rememberme/AbstractRememberMeServices.java#L422-L429
timeline.author: jglick

replies.bodyText: IIRC setHttpOnly reflection was due to previous Tomcat version, with the current one supported by Jenkins, it's no longer necessary as we are using Servlet 3.0+.
replies.author: Wadeck

timeline.bodyText: Deleting this whole package; now constructing security objects directly in Java code. This means dropping support for the dubious feature of overriding Jenkins’ security architecture by replacing a file in the WAR; you would now have to use supported configuration settings only.
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText: Git trying to be too clever. Deleting long-deprecated typo NotSerilizableSecurityContext (not used by plugins); and adding a façade for AccessDeniedException.
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText: Might wind up deleting this, not sure if it could even potentially still be used by plugins.
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.message: Comments
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
Merge branch 'support-log-formatter' into spring-5303
Better logging for ChainedServletFilter
Can now log in; crumbs are broken though
Searched more extensively for references to Acegi Security
HttpSessionContextIntegrationFilter2 was critical after all; just took me a while to find that HttpSessionContextIntegrationFilter is now SecurityContextPersistenceFilter
Comment
Fixing UserSeedProperty so that login works at last
Binary compatibility for QueueItemAuthenticator
Fixing up QueueItemAuthenticator Javadoc
Binary compatibility for SecurityRealm.AUTHENTICATED_AUTHORITY
Binary compatibility for key methods of SecurityRealm and AbstractPasswordBasedSecurityRealm
Even trying to compile at this stage is a waste of CI resources
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
Binary compatibility for User.impersonate and Jenkins.ANONYMOUS
Binary compatibility for ACL.{SYSTEM,impersonate,as}
Tests compile
Giving up on subtyping relationships even for exceptions
Implementing SecurityContext.to/fromSpring allows some functional tests to pass
Do not want spring-jcl as it clashes with the commons-logging we bundle
Some progress on tests using Authentication
org.acegisecurity.userdetails.User must be defined for JenkinsRule.DummySecurityRealm to work
Some tests are passing; may as well start trying CI

timeline.bodyText: There is no replacement for AcegiSecurityException. AFAIK the purpose of this class is to nicely handle 403s, so this should be good enough.
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText: IIRC this class is no longer maintained / outdated as it's preferable for plugins to implement commands directly.
timeline.author: Wadeck

replies.bodyText: It is not currently deprecated, but yes I would recommend CLICommand in all cases.
replies.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText:
I don't understand your question about the signature. You have the variable just above, derived from the expiryTime and username.
It was verified by our current version in TokenBasedRememberMeServices2.java#L256-L266 but in recent version of Spring Security, they have corrected the flaw with the equality and so it's verified (correctly) in TokenBasedRememberMeServices.java#L95.
timeline.author: Wadeck

timeline.message: @Wadeck helped me with TokenBasedRememberMeServices2
TokenBasedRememberMeServices2Test.rememberMeAutoLoginFailure was asserting some debug message removed in Spring Security
Tracked down why WebClient.withBasicApiToken was not working in tests
Binary compatibility for CLICommand.{getTransportAuthentication,setTransportAuth}
ClassFilterImplSanityTest
Rewrote Authentication.to/fromSpring, fixing two tests in QueueTest
Binary compatibility for Jenkins.getAuthentication
Some more sanity checks around ACL.isAnonymous
Binary compatibility for remaining ACL methods
Special round-trip handling for ACL.SYSTEM for compatibility
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
JobTest.readPermission failed because its @LocalData used a pre-jBCrypt password hash
Binary compatibility for User.getUserDetailsForImpersonation
Binary compatibility for SecurityListener
ExtendedReadPermissionTest failed because its @LocalData used a pre-jBCrypt password hash
NPE in QueueItemAuthenticator
LastGrantedAuthoritiesPropertyTest was reliant on the sort order of authorities
StopBuildsCommandTest
Javadoc updates in TokenBasedRememberMeServices2
Accidentally removed code which added sessionSeed
makeTokenSignature can be called when a User is not yet in memory; need to force creation (authentication was already successful at this point)
Also accidentally deleted some code necessary to handle disableRememberMe (SECURITY-996)
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
Rename refactoring missed a couple of overrides
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
Binary compatibility for AccessControlled.hasPermission
Added back DataAccessResourceFailureException & DataRetrievalFailureException
Binary compatibility for Queue.Item.authenticate and affiliated methods
RememberMeServicesProxy is apparently unused by plugins, do not need to care about compatibility
Javadoc fixes
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jenkinsci/jenkins into spring-5303
Compilation error in test

IN NO EVENT SHALL THE - * AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER - * LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM, - * OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN - * THE SOFTWARE. - */ -package hudson.security; - -import org.acegisecurity.Authentication; -import org.acegisecurity.context.SecurityContext; -import org.acegisecurity.userdetails.UserDetails; - -import javax.servlet.http.HttpSession; -import jenkins.security.NonSerializableSecurityContext; - -/** - * {@link UserDetails} that can mark {@link Authentication} invalid. - * - *

- * Tomcat persists sessions by using Java serialization (and - * that includes the security token created by Acegi, which includes this object) - * and when that happens, the next time the server comes back - * it will try to deserialize {@link SecurityContext} that Acegi - * puts into {@link HttpSession} (which transitively includes {@link UserDetails} - * that can be implemented by Hudson. - * - *

- * Such {@link UserDetails} implementation can override the {@link #isInvalid()} - * method and return false, so that such {@link SecurityContext} will be - * dropped before the rest of Acegi sees it. - * - *

- * See JENKINS-1482 - * - * @author Kohsuke Kawaguchi - * @deprecated - * Starting 1.285, Hudson stops persisting {@link Authentication} altogether - * (see {@link NonSerializableSecurityContext}), so there's no need to use this mechanism. - */ -@Deprecated -public interface InvalidatableUserDetails extends UserDetails {
